body:
Rumour has it - HS angstish

This idea came from listening to this song. Hope you enjoy it, I barely write real angst, but it had to be done. *bow*

…

The biggest news for weeks was that Harry and you broke up. It started fast and ended fast. It didn’t have the best base. You were just as famous as him so it was all over the media. You were still longing for him though and he did the same. Maybe if you started slowly it would’ve lasted longer. Even since the breakup you teased each other with subtle things. You were friends after all. But when he started dating a very young model, you were a little more bitter so you took teasing to another level. You knew he’s just dating her to make you jealous or furious.

You were on the main stage in Glastonbury when these things happened and after you played your songs, you added one more.

“How are you feeling Glastonbury?” You asked. The crowd screamed.

“Good. I’m feeling good too. You know my friend, Harry Styles?” Cheers again.

“Yes, we’re still friends. This next song is for him.” The drummer started playing “Rumour has it.”

She, she ain’t real

She ain’t gonna be able to love you like I will

She is a stranger

You and I have history

Or don’t you remember

Sure, she’s got it all

But, baby, is that really what you want

When you stopped for a second you smirked into the camera.

Bless your soul, you’ve got you’re head in the clouds

You made a fool out of you

And, boy, she’s bringing you down

She made your heart melt

But you’re cold to the core

Now rumor has it she ain’t got your love anymore

You let the crowd sing the chorus for you. They loved it.

She is half your age

But I’m guessing that’s the reason that you stayed

I heard you’ve been missing me

You’ve been telling people things that you shouldn’t be

Like when we creep out and she ain’t around

Haven’t you heard the rumors

Bless your soul, you’ve got your head in the clouds

You made a fool out of me

And, boy, you’re bringing me down

You made my heart melt, yet I’m cold to the core

But rumor has it I’m the one you’re leaving her for

You let the crowd sing again. And you danced like crazy, just like Harry does on his concerts. Then you slowed down to sing the bridge. You leaned on the piano.

All of these words whispered in my ear

Tell a story that I cannot bear to hear

Just ‘cause I said it, it don’t mean that I meant it

People say crazy things

Just 'cause I said it, don’t mean that I meant it

Just 'cause you heard it

The crowd sang the last chorus and soon you finished the song. You went really close to your guitarist to sing the last sentence.

But rumor has it he’s the one I’m leaving you for

He blushed but he got used to your teasing by now. The crowd creamed again.

“Harry Styles, that’s for you and Glastonbury have the best night tonight. I love you! Bye!” You ran off stage and were out of breath. Your best friend waited for you and high fives you.

“You were badass.”

“Thanks. Where’s my phone?” You asked. When she handed it to you, you found what you were looking for. A text saying:

“Meet me at my place. Gotta talk to you. H”

You smirked.

answer:
Thank you for requesting! It’s a cute one

69 “We need to talk.”

80 “Does he know about the baby?”

37 “Welcome to fatherhood.”

…

You were nervous. You paced back and forth in the sitting room for a while now. You didn’t know what to do. You called your best friend to come over but she was late as always. Finally when she pulled over, you ran to the door.

“Hey hey! You’re really excited or nervous, I can’t tell yet,” she said when she saw you.

“Yeah, …uhm. I …uh need to talk with you.” As you sat down on the couch, she seemed worried.

“Y/n, did something happen?”

“Yes, I was at the doctor’s in the morning,” you said.

“And?” She was really worried.

“I’m pregnant.”

“Oh my God!” She held her hands on her mouth. She hugged you.

“Congratulations! What was Harry’s reaction? Does he know about the baby?”

“No, not yet. I’m so scared. We didn’t plan a child. I don’t know what he will react.”

“Dear, Harry is your husband. He loves you. He loves pregnant women. He loves kids. He’ll be over the moon!”

“Do you think so?”

“Yes! I’m sure.”

“Okay…” She left a little later and you knew Harry’s coming home soon. You went out to buy a few things and your eyes fell on a cute bib. It was green and had a little turtle on it.

When you got home, you had a little time to pack out and hide the bib. Harry’s got home a little later.

“Hi, love!”

“I’m in the sitting room.”

“Hello, gorgeous!” He pecked your lips.

“Hi!”

“How was your day? Alone, without me.”

“We need to talk,” you were serious.

“Oh, something happened?” He was worried.

“I had to go to see a doctor in the morning, because I wasn’t feeling well lately.”

“Love…”

“He told me something and I wanna show you,” you said. You took the bib from behind you. Harry looked at it and didn’t get it first. Then you pulled out the ultrasound image from your pocket and put it in his hands. He got it now. His jaw dropped and couldn’t say a word yet, but he was smiling which was a good sign.

“Does it mean…?”

“Yes,” you said.

“I love you,” he said and pulled you into a hug. We he broke the hug he cupped your face and connected your foreheads.

“Welcome to fatherhood.”

title: Blood Like Wine - Part I
body:
You join Harry’s tour as a form of extra protection for the fans.

BEFORE YOU READ: there are multiple trigger warnings in this series from the very first part, PLEASE DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU ARE AFFECTED EASILY, mentions of death, abuse and the rest, I cannot begin to stress that enough!

A/N: Hi loves! Welcome to the beginning of my absolute favourite thing that I’ve ever written. This entire series will be written in 3rd person because the descriptions etc. will read better. I got you 3.5k of strange fluffy awkward angst for now, please, please let me know what you think! Kate xx

~Series Masterlist~

October 2017

After two hundred years walking the Earth, exploring endless cities and cultures, finding what you’re good at and what you’re terrible at, learning as much as possible about yourself and others around you as they come in and out of your life, you’d think that you’d learn that the sun still hasn’t changed, and it still affects your mood and your skin.

“Jesus shit,” YN squinted at the bright light, shielding her eyes from the rays that hit right through her line of vision, “Why are you making me do this?” She asked incredulously, setting her sunglasses on top of her nose to avoid on-lookers gawking at her.

A bemused giggle fell from her friend’s lips as she glanced back to YN, a smirk on her face. “I know you’re trying to avoid the daylight more but I found you the perfect job opportunity.” Penny reasoned, dragging her by the hand towards the Apollo in Hammersmith.

It was teeming with people, mostly girls for some reason, and the amount of bodies was making YN itch.

“Penny, I haven’t fed for nearly three weeks this is such a stupid idea!” YN scolded her, frantically tugging her hand away from her friend’s grip. She was hungry, lack of work had denied her the opportunity to feed for a poor amount of time and it was making her weak and restless. That paired with the swarms of people around could only be a recipe for disaster.

“I know, I know! But you gave me an idea the other day when you were saying how good you’d felt after helping that girl away from… you know.” Penny trailed off at the end of her sentence, too afraid to speak the words aloud.

Two hundred years had thankfully prepared YN for the moment almost a month ago when she witnessed a poor girl about to be violently attacked. It was horrible at first, feeling both the victim’s and the attacker’s emotions so close to her, but once she’d tore the sick bastard from the quivering girl’s frame and drained the life from him in the large and vacant woodland she frequented to feed, she’d actually felt good about herself for once.

“Hi,” Penny had skipped the line and was now stood grinning in front of a large security guard, “we have an appointment with, er… Jeff. Azoff.”

The bouncer raised his brows at Penny as if to say ‘really?’, but never actually said anything to her, he just stood watching her, silently telling her ‘nice try’.

Penny panicked internally, shuffling around herself to get YN’s attention, who was too busy staring at the homeless person across the street. Was it acceptable to end his life? He had nothing and no one… no one would miss him.

“YN!” Penny hissed, smacking the top of her arm a couple of times. “Take your sunnies off for God’s sake.”

Get out of your arse, YN! You can’t murder a helpless innocent! Reluctantly peeling the dark shades from her face, she shoved them into her bag and smiled awkwardly at the the towering guard.

“Ah,” the guard was suddenly wide eyed and shifting awkwardly, “you’re the vamp they’re interviewing?”

YN cringed at his choice of words and sighed with irritation. “Yes, I’m the vampire they’re interviewing.” She answered bluntly.

¬

“Well, Mrs YLN,”

“It’s Miss.” YN answered shortly, forgetting herself and who she was talking with. “Sorry, er, I’m just Miss. I’m not married.”

Mr Azoff smiled at her sweetly, already forgiving her cold interruption without a second thought on it. “My apologies, Miss YLN, I don’t know how much your friend has told you but we’d really appreciate your help this evening.”

She wriggled uncomfortably for a short moment. YN had no idea what she was here for, Penny had said nothing, and Mr Azoff had only asked normal interviewing questions and vaguely touched on her abilities. “What would I be doing..?”

Once again Mr Azoff appeared to ignore her irritated and bored composure and smiled brilliantly at her. “If you hadn’t already noticed my client is holding a show here tonight, and unfortunately with the amount of younger girls here the number of…” He struggled for the right word, “harassments that occur has been quite frightening. I understand you haven’t fed for a while and this could be difficult for you, but my client and I’s number one priority is to keep the audience safe. I can’t imagine a better way to do that than with you.”

The idea was intriguing, for sure. YN had never been one of those vampires who just drank from whoever. Humans deserved as much respect as vampires did, and though humans were certainly larger in numbers (there were only around ten thousand vampires in existence at any one time) it didn’t mean they were disposable. So YN had adopted a system very early on in her life whereby she would only feed from someone who was already dying or could be deemed not worthy of living (like abusers and murderers). Because of her favour for human life she was an outcast within her community, and very few vampires respected they way she lived out her existence. Some had adopted the same habits, though they were often hard to find. To be able to work helping those humans, and possibly feeding at the same time was a win-win, surely?

“I guess it can’t hurt for one evening.” She agreed, finally smiling at Mr Azoff.

He beamed at her, standing promptly from his seat in the large arena. “Excellent!” He extended a hand out towards YN, who took it once she stood to give him a gentle shake. “Let me introduce you to a few people, and then we can get you out where we need you.”

¬

“Where is Jeffrey?” Harry grumbled as he dressed himself for the evening in his next outlandish suit.

“He’s recreating Tom Cruise’s ninety four classic.” Mitch snorted at his own joke, assessing his fresh trim in the mirror.

Harry turned to Mitch with a raised brow. “What?”

“He’s in the arena doing an interview. We heard she’s a vamp.” Sarah clarified for him.

“What do we need one of those for?” He frowned, the idea of having one in amongst his fans terrifying him somewhat.

“She’s that one that famously started the ‘feeding only when they’re cunts’ lifestyle.” Mitch said casually, as if he hadn’t just dropped the ‘c’ word mid sentence.

Sarah frowned at Mitch for his choice of word but neglected to mention her disapproval. “You know the one, can’t remember her name but she’s pretty cool. Loads of vampy talents, loves us hoomans. Saw her in the hall with Jeff earlier and she was super beautiful, not in a way you’d expect though.”

Harry pursed his lips in thought, shaking his head. “No, doesn’t ring a bell.”

¬

Mr Azoff had introduced YN to a flurry of crew members working on the show that night, mostly those of importance and who she might need to go to for any assistance, though it was incredibly unlikely that would happen.

“I just need to go and do something real quick.” Mr Azoff gushed as they stopped outside a dressing room door. “Wait right here.”

YN stood awkwardly in the hallway as she waited for Mr Azoff to do his errand, admiring the plethora of artists that littered the walls. She rarely visited events like this, mostly to avoid temptation from the mass amounts of humans, though she often occupied her free time watching old concert performances on Sky Arts just out of curiosity. She didn’t deny that she could probably handle herself if she really had to, but even still, some humans had such a strong and desirable scent it was too much to worth the risk. Any other vampire would just do it.

“Are you okay?” A gloriously deep tone hummed at her from down the hall, the vibrations of the voice echoing off the walls like an excited bouncy ball.

It was instinctive of her to snap her attention to whoever it was without thought, and her heart skipped for the sight in front of her. She recognised him, only for the fact that Penny had his album playing on repeat at all hours of the day, along with any of his previous work. She’d always found him attractive, even for a human, but stood in front of him now, actually in the flesh, he was only what YN could describe as God-like, and definitely worthy. A vampire lifestyle would have suited him so well, there was no doubt about that.

Harry felt her eyes piercing into his, and they were an incredible sight to behold. Impossibly they were an even darker and more striking green than his own, closer to a rich mossy colour, her pupils dilated so much that their colour was only a thin ring bordering them. Sarah had been right, she was beautiful in a peculiar way, almost as if she was accidentally born of her nature. Yet it still fit her perfectly, as she stood in front of him with a bizarre and unfitting coyness, pulling her sleeve over her hand in an almost uncomfortable and awkward manner.

Little did Harry know that his scent had YN’s mouth watering instantly, the thumbnail that instinctively sharpened to a point when she grew ravenous threatening to rip through the fabric of her jumper’s cuff, and she was really, really struggling to hold back her natural tendencies. She swallowed the saliva that threatened in her mouth, taking a deep breath to at least attempt to calm the burning desire in her throat.

“I’m, um, just waiting for Mr Azoff.” Her voice was quiet, but still an absolutely lovely sound to listen to. But that’s the way she was meant to be. It’s what they were designed for, to be completely desirable and seductive, even when they weren’t really trying.

Harry nodded once as he understood that it was definitely her that Jeff had been interviewing. “I see, you’re the vamp he’s hiring?”

Again with the abbreviation of her kind, she hated how the modern world often ruined such sacred pieces of history. “That would be me, yes. Just for this evening, anyway.” YN offered a tight smile, averting her gaze from his and back to the frames on the wall.

“Harold!” Jeff’s booming voice came from behind them. “Good, you’ve already met.” He slapped a hand to Harry’s back and grinned. “YN is helping tonight to… warden the crowds.”

Harry nodded. “So I’ve heard.” His tone was light, though the surly female standing with them admittedly dampened his mood slightly, even if she was a sight to look at.

YN turned back to Mr Azoff with a small smile, not wanting to appear rude to her temporary employer.

“Let’s get you settled!” Jeff said with a loud clap of his hands, causing Harry to jump a little as YN barely winced.

¬

As the Apollo filled with people YN wandered around through the aisles, ignoring the occasional gawks she received. She attempted to concentrate more on the emotions of the people entering, focussing mostly on those of distress or… arousal. It grew more difficult as the room became full of gushing fans, some of whom really did smell good, though nowhere near as good as Harry had earlier.

The show started, and YN became overwhelmed with the fans excitement through the room, making it extremely difficult to focus on much more than the burning in her throat. She continued to move around, catching sight of Harry’s daft antics on stage every now and then and smiling to herself. She was well aware that the marks on her neck and face were probably visible, and was no doubt the reason so many people were staring at her, so to avoid looking like a complete misery she offered each gawker a smile, all of whom suddenly smiled back.

For a while it all seemed pretty quiet, but then she felt it.

YN felt that gut wrenching, heart aching feeling of a young girl in distress, coupled with another’s aggression, and she knew this was why she was here. She followed her internal map to the couple caught up in a scurry in the middle of a crowded and utterly packed show. She shoved through the audience, trying to be as polite but as urgent as possible as she squeezed through the crammed floor. There he was, tall and broad, his hands running along this tiny framed girl’s hips and waist as she very obviously tried to wriggle away from him.

YN braced herself for what she was about to do, ignoring the fact that everyone within a three metre radius had now focussed their attention from Harry’s performance to the horrible scene in front of them.

Harry had noticed it, noticed the absence of attention after only a few seconds, and he could see one of his fans struggling. YN was right there, and boy was she a confusing sight, one that was simultaneously nightmarish and seductive all at the same time. It was right there and then that Harry knew she’d got it under control, and that it was in everyone’s best interest to carry on as if nothing was happening.

Running a hand along his back, YN felt the man’s frame stiffen at her delicate touch as she silkily slid between him and the distressed fan. Paying little attention to the girl for the moment, YN forced her gaze into the eyes of her new prey, who had lost all self consciousness and was now completely hers to deal with. She smiled up at him, her eyes full of deceiving warmth as she continued to stroke his chest with one hand. He would be a good feed, his size no doubt enough to keep her going for a few weeks.

Before YN could finish the deed she turned herself and her prey so that she was facing the stage and the petrified fan. “Are you okay?” The fan nodded furiously, though her tears might suggest otherwise, and YN felt sick for her. Gazing back to the attacker she wrapped her free hand around his throat, her thumbnail grazing the pulsing flesh of the vein on his neck. She met Harry’s eye line momentarily, before closing her eyes and willing her presence into the woodland to dispose of her human conquest.

The crowd around her gasped as her body vanished with that of the horrible man, and Harry struggled to keep his composure. Why did he insist on watching her when he knew what the outcome would be? Now he felt ill. She probably wouldn’t even come back, vampires were known to be selfish that way.

The second YN felt the mossy, bark floor beneath her she twisted her prey’s neck, ending his despicable existence. Her nail pierced the soft flesh on his neck, a small bead of thick, crimson blood releasing from the cut. Pressing her lips to the vein her natural instinct took over as she drained the blood from his limp body, finally subsiding the painful flame that had resided in her throat for almost a week. Small and frustrated whimpers escaped her as she drank, the blood not tasting anywhere near as good as she’d hoped. It was dirty, probably ruined from medication or nasty habits, but at least she was fed, and she didn’t have to focus on feeding for a while.

Hurling the dead man’s body into the small lake with a heavy stone attached to his middle, she watched the little bubbles rise to the surface until they completely stopped and she was satisfied he would never be discovered. It was a horrible way to send someone out of this life and into the next, but he was a terrible man, and she didn’t feel even a little guilty knowing that his body would lie on the cold floor of the lake’s surface, along with all the other bastards she’d drained.

There was a small waterfall nearby that she would always wash in after a big feed, just to be sure she didn’t return to wherever she came from in a terrifying mess. The cold water never bothered her, she just enjoyed the naturalness of being with the earth as she cleansed herself, both in body and mind. There was something about this place she’d discovered so many years ago, it was like a little capsule of another world. No one ever ventured here besides her, and she was convinced that no one else knew it existed.

When YN found herself back at the arena she was sad to see the show had ended. She frantically searched for the fan she’d helped, feeling a little deflated when she was nowhere to be seen.

“She’s backstage.” Mr Azoff’s voice carried through the emptying room.

YN whirled to see him waiting by the fence. “She is?”

Mr Azoff nodded with a small smirk. “Harry asked to have her and her friend brought backstage after you disappeared. I don’t think he thought you’d come back.”

She frowned at him him, disappointed that he’d apparently created such a poor impression of her so soon. “Oh…”

“You’re more than welcome to prove him wrong.” Mr Azoff raised his brows at her with a mischievous grin.

YN couldn’t help the matching expression she gave him, and followed after him through to the halls she’d been lurking in beforehand. The girl was with Harry, who was keeping a comfortable distance whilst assuring her that he doesn’t intend for anything like that to happen during his performances. She was still evidently upset, her hands shaking as she thanked him for being so wonderful.

“Hope you don’t mind us interrupting,” Jeff knocked lightly on the open door, “someone came back to check on you.”

YN peeked in from behind Jeff with a sweet smile. “Hi.”

Harry couldn’t help but notice her eyes again, and the fact that they were now a whole new shade of beautiful butterscotch, no doubt from her unspoken feed. Her hair was damp, no longer in the little bun it had been in earlier as it fell around her shoulders. Had she really had time to shower? He also noticed that she seemed much more relaxed, even as she walked into the room to embrace the grateful girl, she didn’t seem so uptight. So that was it, she really was just hungry earlier.

He was glad that she had come back, it meant she really was different to all the other vamps out there who treated humans like shit on their shoes. Whoever YN was, she was lovely, and she was special.

~Part II~

Thank you babies! <3
body_abstract:
You join Harry’s tour as a form of extra protection for the fans.

BEFORE YOU READ: there are multiple trigger warnings in this series from the very first part, PLEASE DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU ARE AFFECTED EASILY, mentions of death, abuse and the rest, I cannot begin to stress that enough!

A/N: Hi loves! Welcome to the beginning of my absolute favourite thing that I’ve ever written. This entire series will be written in 3rd person because the descriptions etc. will read better. I got you 3.5k of strange fluffy awkward angst for now, please, please let me know what you think! Kate xx

~Series Masterlist~

October 2017

After two hundred years walking the Earth, exploring endless cities and cultures, finding what you’re good at and what you’re terrible at, learning as much as possible about yourself and others around you as they come in and out of your life, you’d think that you’d learn that the sun still hasn’t changed, and it still affects your mood and your skin.

“Jesus shit,” YN squinted at the bright light, shielding her eyes from the rays that hit right through her line of vision, “Why are you making me do this?” She asked incredulously, setting her sunglasses on top of her nose to avoid on-lookers gawking at her.

You join Harry’s tour as a form of extra protection for the fans.

BEFORE YOU READ: there are multiple trigger warnings in this series from the very first part, PLEASE DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU ARE AFFECTED EASILY, mentions of death, abuse and the rest, I cannot begin to stress that enough!

A/N: Hi loves! Welcome to the beginning of my absolute favourite thing that I’ve ever written. This entire series will be written in 3rd person because the descriptions etc. will read better. I got you 3.5k of strange fluffy awkward angst for now, please, please let me know what you think! Kate xx

~Series Masterlist~

October 2017

After two hundred years walking the Earth, exploring endless cities and cultures, finding what you’re good at and what you’re terrible at, learning as much as possible about yourself and others around you as they come in and out of your life, you’d think that you’d learn that the sun still hasn’t changed, and it still affects your mood and your skin.

“Jesus shit,” YN squinted at the bright light, shielding her eyes from the rays that hit right through her line of vision, “Why are you making me do this?” She asked incredulously, setting her sunglasses on top of her nose to avoid on-lookers gawking at her.

[[MORE]]

A bemused giggle fell from her friend’s lips as she glanced back to YN, a smirk on her face. “I know you’re trying to avoid the daylight more but I found you the perfect job opportunity.” Penny reasoned, dragging her by the hand towards the Apollo in Hammersmith.

It was teeming with people, mostly girls for some reason, and the amount of bodies was making YN itch.

“Penny, I haven’t fed for nearly three weeks this is such a stupid idea!” YN scolded her, frantically tugging her hand away from her friend’s grip. She was hungry, lack of work had denied her the opportunity to feed for a poor amount of time and it was making her weak and restless. That paired with the swarms of people around could only be a recipe for disaster.

“I know, I know! But you gave me an idea the other day when you were saying how good you’d felt after helping that girl away from… you know.” Penny trailed off at the end of her sentence, too afraid to speak the words aloud.

Two hundred years had thankfully prepared YN for the moment almost a month ago when she witnessed a poor girl about to be violently attacked. It was horrible at first, feeling both the victim’s and the attacker’s emotions so close to her, but once she’d tore the sick bastard from the quivering girl’s frame and drained the life from him in the large and vacant woodland she frequented to feed, she’d actually felt good about herself for once.

“Hi,” Penny had skipped the line and was now stood grinning in front of a large security guard, “we have an appointment with, er… Jeff. Azoff.”

The bouncer raised his brows at Penny as if to say ‘really?’, but never actually said anything to her, he just stood watching her, silently telling her ‘nice try’.

Penny panicked internally, shuffling around herself to get YN’s attention, who was too busy staring at the homeless person across the street. Was it acceptable to end his life? He had nothing and no one… no one would miss him.

“YN!” Penny hissed, smacking the top of her arm a couple of times. “Take your sunnies off for God’s sake.”

Get out of your arse, YN! You can’t murder a helpless innocent! Reluctantly peeling the dark shades from her face, she shoved them into her bag and smiled awkwardly at the the towering guard.

“Ah,” the guard was suddenly wide eyed and shifting awkwardly, “you’re the vamp they’re interviewing?”

YN cringed at his choice of words and sighed with irritation. “Yes, I’m the vampire they’re interviewing.” She answered bluntly.

¬

“Well, Mrs YLN,”

“It’s Miss.” YN answered shortly, forgetting herself and who she was talking with. “Sorry, er, I’m just Miss. I’m not married.”

Mr Azoff smiled at her sweetly, already forgiving her cold interruption without a second thought on it. “My apologies, Miss YLN, I don’t know how much your friend has told you but we’d really appreciate your help this evening.”

She wriggled uncomfortably for a short moment. YN had no idea what she was here for, Penny had said nothing, and Mr Azoff had only asked normal interviewing questions and vaguely touched on her abilities. “What would I be doing..?”

Once again Mr Azoff appeared to ignore her irritated and bored composure and smiled brilliantly at her. “If you hadn’t already noticed my client is holding a show here tonight, and unfortunately with the amount of younger girls here the number of…” He struggled for the right word, “harassments that occur has been quite frightening. I understand you haven’t fed for a while and this could be difficult for you, but my client and I’s number one priority is to keep the audience safe. I can’t imagine a better way to do that than with you.”

The idea was intriguing, for sure. YN had never been one of those vampires who just drank from whoever. Humans deserved as much respect as vampires did, and though humans were certainly larger in numbers (there were only around ten thousand vampires in existence at any one time) it didn’t mean they were disposable. So YN had adopted a system very early on in her life whereby she would only feed from someone who was already dying or could be deemed not worthy of living (like abusers and murderers). Because of her favour for human life she was an outcast within her community, and very few vampires respected they way she lived out her existence. Some had adopted the same habits, though they were often hard to find. To be able to work helping those humans, and possibly feeding at the same time was a win-win, surely?

“I guess it can’t hurt for one evening.” She agreed, finally smiling at Mr Azoff.

He beamed at her, standing promptly from his seat in the large arena. “Excellent!” He extended a hand out towards YN, who took it once she stood to give him a gentle shake. “Let me introduce you to a few people, and then we can get you out where we need you.”

¬

“Where is Jeffrey?” Harry grumbled as he dressed himself for the evening in his next outlandish suit.

“He’s recreating Tom Cruise’s ninety four classic.” Mitch snorted at his own joke, assessing his fresh trim in the mirror.

Harry turned to Mitch with a raised brow. “What?”

“He’s in the arena doing an interview. We heard she’s a vamp.” Sarah clarified for him.

“What do we need one of those for?” He frowned, the idea of having one in amongst his fans terrifying him somewhat.

“She’s that one that famously started the ‘feeding only when they’re cunts’ lifestyle.” Mitch said casually, as if he hadn’t just dropped the ‘c’ word mid sentence.

Sarah frowned at Mitch for his choice of word but neglected to mention her disapproval. “You know the one, can’t remember her name but she’s pretty cool. Loads of vampy talents, loves us hoomans. Saw her in the hall with Jeff earlier and she was super beautiful, not in a way you’d expect though.”

Harry pursed his lips in thought, shaking his head. “No, doesn’t ring a bell.”

¬

Mr Azoff had introduced YN to a flurry of crew members working on the show that night, mostly those of importance and who she might need to go to for any assistance, though it was incredibly unlikely that would happen.

“I just need to go and do something real quick.” Mr Azoff gushed as they stopped outside a dressing room door. “Wait right here.”

YN stood awkwardly in the hallway as she waited for Mr Azoff to do his errand, admiring the plethora of artists that littered the walls. She rarely visited events like this, mostly to avoid temptation from the mass amounts of humans, though she often occupied her free time watching old concert performances on Sky Arts just out of curiosity. She didn’t deny that she could probably handle herself if she really had to, but even still, some humans had such a strong and desirable scent it was too much to worth the risk. Any other vampire would just do it.

“Are you okay?” A gloriously deep tone hummed at her from down the hall, the vibrations of the voice echoing off the walls like an excited bouncy ball.

It was instinctive of her to snap her attention to whoever it was without thought, and her heart skipped for the sight in front of her. She recognised him, only for the fact that Penny had his album playing on repeat at all hours of the day, along with any of his previous work. She’d always found him attractive, even for a human, but stood in front of him now, actually in the flesh, he was only what YN could describe as God-like, and definitely worthy. A vampire lifestyle would have suited him so well, there was no doubt about that.

Harry felt her eyes piercing into his, and they were an incredible sight to behold. Impossibly they were an even darker and more striking green than his own, closer to a rich mossy colour, her pupils dilated so much that their colour was only a thin ring bordering them. Sarah had been right, she was beautiful in a peculiar way, almost as if she was accidentally born of her nature. Yet it still fit her perfectly, as she stood in front of him with a bizarre and unfitting coyness, pulling her sleeve over her hand in an almost uncomfortable and awkward manner.

Little did Harry know that his scent had YN’s mouth watering instantly, the thumbnail that instinctively sharpened to a point when she grew ravenous threatening to rip through the fabric of her jumper’s cuff, and she was really, really struggling to hold back her natural tendencies. She swallowed the saliva that threatened in her mouth, taking a deep breath to at least attempt to calm the burning desire in her throat.

“I’m, um, just waiting for Mr Azoff.” Her voice was quiet, but still an absolutely lovely sound to listen to. But that’s the way she was meant to be. It’s what they were designed for, to be completely desirable and seductive, even when they weren’t really trying.

Harry nodded once as he understood that it was definitely her that Jeff had been interviewing. “I see, you’re the vamp he’s hiring?”

Again with the abbreviation of her kind, she hated how the modern world often ruined such sacred pieces of history. “That would be me, yes. Just for this evening, anyway.” YN offered a tight smile, averting her gaze from his and back to the frames on the wall.

“Harold!” Jeff’s booming voice came from behind them. “Good, you’ve already met.” He slapped a hand to Harry’s back and grinned. “YN is helping tonight to… warden the crowds.”

Harry nodded. “So I’ve heard.” His tone was light, though the surly female standing with them admittedly dampened his mood slightly, even if she was a sight to look at.

YN turned back to Mr Azoff with a small smile, not wanting to appear rude to her temporary employer.

“Let’s get you settled!” Jeff said with a loud clap of his hands, causing Harry to jump a little as YN barely winced.

¬

As the Apollo filled with people YN wandered around through the aisles, ignoring the occasional gawks she received. She attempted to concentrate more on the emotions of the people entering, focussing mostly on those of distress or… arousal. It grew more difficult as the room became full of gushing fans, some of whom really did smell good, though nowhere near as good as Harry had earlier.

The show started, and YN became overwhelmed with the fans excitement through the room, making it extremely difficult to focus on much more than the burning in her throat. She continued to move around, catching sight of Harry’s daft antics on stage every now and then and smiling to herself. She was well aware that the marks on her neck and face were probably visible, and was no doubt the reason so many people were staring at her, so to avoid looking like a complete misery she offered each gawker a smile, all of whom suddenly smiled back.

For a while it all seemed pretty quiet, but then she felt it.

YN felt that gut wrenching, heart aching feeling of a young girl in distress, coupled with another’s aggression, and she knew this was why she was here. She followed her internal map to the couple caught up in a scurry in the middle of a crowded and utterly packed show. She shoved through the audience, trying to be as polite but as urgent as possible as she squeezed through the crammed floor. There he was, tall and broad, his hands running along this tiny framed girl’s hips and waist as she very obviously tried to wriggle away from him.

YN braced herself for what she was about to do, ignoring the fact that everyone within a three metre radius had now focussed their attention from Harry’s performance to the horrible scene in front of them.

Harry had noticed it, noticed the absence of attention after only a few seconds, and he could see one of his fans struggling. YN was right there, and boy was she a confusing sight, one that was simultaneously nightmarish and seductive all at the same time. It was right there and then that Harry knew she’d got it under control, and that it was in everyone’s best interest to carry on as if nothing was happening.

Running a hand along his back, YN felt the man’s frame stiffen at her delicate touch as she silkily slid between him and the distressed fan. Paying little attention to the girl for the moment, YN forced her gaze into the eyes of her new prey, who had lost all self consciousness and was now completely hers to deal with. She smiled up at him, her eyes full of deceiving warmth as she continued to stroke his chest with one hand. He would be a good feed, his size no doubt enough to keep her going for a few weeks.

Before YN could finish the deed she turned herself and her prey so that she was facing the stage and the petrified fan. “Are you okay?” The fan nodded furiously, though her tears might suggest otherwise, and YN felt sick for her. Gazing back to the attacker she wrapped her free hand around his throat, her thumbnail grazing the pulsing flesh of the vein on his neck. She met Harry’s eye line momentarily, before closing her eyes and willing her presence into the woodland to dispose of her human conquest.

The crowd around her gasped as her body vanished with that of the horrible man, and Harry struggled to keep his composure. Why did he insist on watching her when he knew what the outcome would be? Now he felt ill. She probably wouldn’t even come back, vampires were known to be selfish that way.

The second YN felt the mossy, bark floor beneath her she twisted her prey’s neck, ending his despicable existence. Her nail pierced the soft flesh on his neck, a small bead of thick, crimson blood releasing from the cut. Pressing her lips to the vein her natural instinct took over as she drained the blood from his limp body, finally subsiding the painful flame that had resided in her throat for almost a week. Small and frustrated whimpers escaped her as she drank, the blood not tasting anywhere near as good as she’d hoped. It was dirty, probably ruined from medication or nasty habits, but at least she was fed, and she didn’t have to focus on feeding for a while.

Hurling the dead man’s body into the small lake with a heavy stone attached to his middle, she watched the little bubbles rise to the surface until they completely stopped and she was satisfied he would never be discovered. It was a horrible way to send someone out of this life and into the next, but he was a terrible man, and she didn’t feel even a little guilty knowing that his body would lie on the cold floor of the lake’s surface, along with all the other bastards she’d drained.

There was a small waterfall nearby that she would always wash in after a big feed, just to be sure she didn’t return to wherever she came from in a terrifying mess. The cold water never bothered her, she just enjoyed the naturalness of being with the earth as she cleansed herself, both in body and mind. There was something about this place she’d discovered so many years ago, it was like a little capsule of another world. No one ever ventured here besides her, and she was convinced that no one else knew it existed.

When YN found herself back at the arena she was sad to see the show had ended. She frantically searched for the fan she’d helped, feeling a little deflated when she was nowhere to be seen.

“She’s backstage.” Mr Azoff’s voice carried through the emptying room.

YN whirled to see him waiting by the fence. “She is?”

Mr Azoff nodded with a small smirk. “Harry asked to have her and her friend brought backstage after you disappeared. I don’t think he thought you’d come back.”

She frowned at him him, disappointed that he’d apparently created such a poor impression of her so soon. “Oh…”

“You’re more than welcome to prove him wrong.” Mr Azoff raised his brows at her with a mischievous grin.

YN couldn’t help the matching expression she gave him, and followed after him through to the halls she’d been lurking in beforehand. The girl was with Harry, who was keeping a comfortable distance whilst assuring her that he doesn’t intend for anything like that to happen during his performances. She was still evidently upset, her hands shaking as she thanked him for being so wonderful.

“Hope you don’t mind us interrupting,” Jeff knocked lightly on the open door, “someone came back to check on you.”

YN peeked in from behind Jeff with a sweet smile. “Hi.”

Harry couldn’t help but notice her eyes again, and the fact that they were now a whole new shade of beautiful butterscotch, no doubt from her unspoken feed. Her hair was damp, no longer in the little bun it had been in earlier as it fell around her shoulders. Had she really had time to shower? He also noticed that she seemed much more relaxed, even as she walked into the room to embrace the grateful girl, she didn’t seem so uptight. So that was it, she really was just hungry earlier.

He was glad that she had come back, it meant she really was different to all the other vamps out there who treated humans like shit on their shoes. Whoever YN was, she was lovely, and she was special.

~Part II~

Thank you babies! <3

The cold water never bothered her, she just enjoyed the naturalness of being with the earth as she cleansed herself, both in body and mind. There was something about this place she’d discovered so many years ago, it was like a little capsule of another world. No one ever ventured here besides her, and she was convinced that no one else knew it existed.

When YN found herself back at the arena she was sad to see the show had ended. She frantically searched for the fan she’d helped, feeling a little deflated when she was nowhere to be seen.

“She’s backstage.” Mr Azoff’s voice carried through the emptying room.

YN whirled to see him waiting by the fence. “She is?”

Mr Azoff nodded with a small smirk. “Harry asked to have her and her friend brought backstage after you disappeared. I don’t think he thought you’d come back.”

She frowned at him him, disappointed that he’d apparently created such a poor impression of her so soon. “Oh…”

“You’re more than welcome to prove him wrong.” Mr Azoff raised his brows at her with a mischievous grin.

YN couldn’t help the matching expression she gave him, and followed after him through to the halls she’d been lurking in beforehand. The girl was with Harry, who was keeping a comfortable distance whilst assuring her that he doesn’t intend for anything like that to happen during his performances. She was still evidently upset, her hands shaking as she thanked him for being so wonderful.

“Hope you don’t mind us interrupting,” Jeff knocked lightly on the open door, “someone came back to check on you.”

YN peeked in from behind Jeff with a sweet smile. “Hi.”

Harry couldn’t help but notice her eyes again, and the fact that they were now a whole new shade of beautiful butterscotch, no doubt from her unspoken feed. Her hair was damp, no longer in the little bun it had been in earlier as it fell around her shoulders. Had she really had time to shower? He also noticed that she seemed much more relaxed, even as she walked into the room to embrace the grateful girl, she didn’t seem so uptight. So that was it, she really was just hungry earlier.

He was glad that she had come back, it meant she really was different to all the other vamps out there who treated humans like shit on their shoes. Whoever YN was, she was lovely, and she was special.

~Part II~

Thank you babies! <3

You join Harry’s tour as a form of extra protection for the fans.

BEFORE YOU READ: there are multiple trigger warnings in this series from the very first part, PLEASE DO NOT READ THIS IF YOU ARE AFFECTED EASILY, mentions of death, abuse and the rest, I cannot begin to stress that enough!

A/N: Hi loves! Welcome to the beginning of my absolute favourite thing that I’ve ever written. This entire series will be written in 3rd person because the descriptions etc. will read better. I got you 3.5k of strange fluffy awkward angst for now, please, please let me know what you think! Kate xx

~Series Masterlist~

October 2017

After two hundred years walking the Earth, exploring endless cities and cultures, finding what you’re good at and what you’re terrible at, learning as much as possible about yourself and others around you as they come in and out of your life, you’d think that you’d learn that the sun still hasn’t changed, and it still affects your mood and your skin.

“Jesus shit,” YN squinted at the bright light, shielding her eyes from the rays that hit right through her line of vision, “Why are you making me do this?” She asked incredulously, setting her sunglasses on top of her nose to avoid on-lookers gawking at her.

body:
Zarry Spy Fic (Part 2)

Part 1


- Zayn returns from whatever murder spree he’d gone off on to avoid Harry and smiles at him tiredly.

- So Harry knows there’s no hard feelings.

- “It’s hard for Liam to look at me sometimes. Is it like that for you too?” Harry asks zayn at 3am.

- (No it’s hard for me to look away, zayn thinks)

- “You don’t look that much like him.”

- Harry doesn’t miss the wording. You don’t look that much like him. Not you two don’t look that similar. He’s always going to be compared to his brother. It doesn’t matter if he dies trying.

- So he smiles sadly and says he’s tired.

- (And leaves Zayn wondering what he said wrong. Shit he’s in so deep, he doesn’t know his head from his arse. And Harry somehow has this contorted notion that he’s in love with Alex. Jesus, maybe it’s better that way. Zayn cannot put him at more risk than he already is.)

- (“He thinks I’m in love with you.” He tells Al.)

- (“You’re both really fucking stupid for being two of the smartest people i know.” Al replies.)

- (Zayn doesn’t know if that’s an insult or a compliment)

- (“Don’t you think it’s really weird cause you two are, you know…” Zayn makes a face.)

- (“Twins?” Al deadpans, “You say it like it’s a bad word. Why would it be weird for my best friend to want to fuck someone who looks like me?”)

- (“You’re an asshole.” Zayn declares.)

- Harry also has an aggressive Alsatian dog called Woo (short for Woovie) that Alex got him for his twentieth birthday.

- Who is now in Zayn’s apartment because Jesse is sick of babysitting him for Harry.

- He hates all of them and curls around Harry’s legs protectively whenever he’s around.

- Zayn didn’t even know unfriendly dogs existed.

- It’s good for Liam though.

- Because as much as harry wears garish shirts and has hair long enough that Alex would tut at it, he still looks so much like Alex with a worried frown permanently on his face that lines are starting to blur for Liam.

- It doesn’t help that he’s incredibly charming and laughs so easily despite obviously suffering inside.

- And Liam loves Alex, would probably give his life for him. He would never ever go there, but his heart just aches so much for Alex that sometimes he wants to soothe it by hugging Harry within an inch of his life.

- It doesn’t help that Harry is a tactile person and never refuses a cuddle.

- Not that Liam’s ever partook in one. It’s only ever Louis and Zayn, mostly Zayn.

- Zayn, who gravitates towards Harry in the same way he used to with Alex when they’d just become partners.

- But it’s different, Liam can tell.

- By the three month mark, Harry takes to roaming the hospital corridors aimlessly for hours after his shift.

- Zayn, who’s his permanent shadow nowadays, does not comment.

- Just walks beside him and grabs him by the elbow when he tires himself out enough to start running into walls.

- It’s hard for Zayn to see Harry fall apart piece by piece right in front of his eyes.

- (“I can’t– it’s not right Al, he deserves to know.”)

- (“You know we can’t do that.” Al’s eyes harden, “I don’t want to see Haz suffering any more than you do.”)

- (Zayn swallows, “He’ll hate me.”)

- (Al’s eyes soften, “Harry can’t hate anyone, it’s not in his DNA.”)

- (“You have the same DNA and you hate almost everyone you meet.” Zayn points out.)

- (“Yeah well, I got his half too which is why I’m more full of spite than the normal person.”)

- (Zayn smiles, “They all miss you.”)

- (“I know.”)

- “Alex made enemies in high places.” Zayn tells them two months later, “By the end of our mission we knew we were fucked. There was no way Alex could come back without being hunted by at least five separate organisations.”

- “What are you saying Zayn?” Harry asks after a quiet moment.

- Zayn can’t look him in the eyes but he has to, he has to, because Harry deserves it.

- “Alex is alive.”

- A pin drop silence before Liam makes a sound somewhere between a sob and a growl, “And I suppose you knew all along?”

- Zayn has to steel himself. He doesn’t have the courage to look at Harry anymore. He looks at his shoes instead.

- “Yes, I knew.” And before anyone can open their mouth, he continues, “But only because I was there and Alex needed my help. He didn’t want to put any of you at risk.”

- “Why are you telling us now then? Is he safe now?” Louis asks since neither Harry not Liam seem to be able to speak.

- Zayn nods, “He wasn’t in good terms with the government here, so we made a deal with the US government. Immunity in exchange for information. It was a risky line to walk, our bosses were likely to go after him. It’s why it took so long.”

- “And he didn’t think he could trust us?” Liam shakes with the restraint on his obvious anger, “Trust me?”

- “Liam–“

- “No. Don’t.” He stands up and walks out, shutting the door with such force that Zayn’s key bowl falls and shatters.

- Harry moves back to his apartment a few days later, not having said a single word to Zayn after the broken little “why” he had uttered to break the silence after Liam had stormed out.

- Zayn doesn’t have an answer for him.

- Harry meets Alex the day before he leaves the country.

- “Liam broke up with me.” Is the first thing Alex tells him. The second is, “I’m sorry, I’m so sorry.”

- “I understand, and I’m sorry too.” Harry says.

- He doesn’t tell Alex how Liam visited him once a week at the least and how he had cried for hours the evening before he was supposed to break up with Alex.

- He doesn’t tell him Liam’s reasoning for it. How it’s not just because Alex had him thinking he was missing and possibly dead for five months.

- “I’ll be okay.” Alex gives him a pathetic attempt of a smile.

- “Yes you will.” Harry steps forward and hugs him, “You’re Alex.”

- Alex hugs him back tightly enough to numb him, “Will you visit me?”

- “I will try.” Harry answers honestly.

- Alex pulls away and nods. “Okay. I’m sorry for everything. You deserve a better brother.”

- “I don’t know, I don’t mind you too much.”

- Alex smiles and Harry smiles back.

- “Take care Allie.”

- “You too Hazza.”

- “You lied to me for five months.”

- Zayn sighs, “I know, and I’m sorry.”

- “You also didn’t tell me that you tried to convince Alex to tell me he was alive.”

- “I didn’t think it would matter.”

- A warm hand covers his and Zayn looks up to meet Harry’s eyes.

- “Yeah well, it matters to me.”

———————————————————————

A/N : This fic has been rotting in my drafts for like 2 years and I knew I was never gonna have the motivation to actually write it. So I thought I might as well post this.

If anyone wants to actually write this, you can dm me and we’ll work something out!

- (“You’re both really fucking stupid for being two of the smartest people i know.” Al replies.)

- (Zayn doesn’t know if that’s an insult or a compliment)

- (“Don’t you think it’s really weird cause you two are, you know…” Zayn makes a face.)

- (“Twins?” Al deadpans, “You say it like it’s a bad word. Why would it be weird for my best friend to want to fuck someone who looks like me?”)

- (“You’re an asshole.” Zayn declares.)

- Harry also has an aggressive Alsatian dog called Woo (short for Woovie) that Alex got him for his twentieth birthday.

- Who is now in Zayn’s apartment because Jesse is sick of babysitting him for Harry.

- He hates all of them and curls around Harry’s legs protectively whenever he’s around.

- Zayn didn’t even know unfriendly dogs existed.

- It’s good for Liam though.

- Because as much as harry wears garish shirts and has hair long enough that Alex would tut at it, he still looks so much like Alex with a worried frown permanently on his face that lines are starting to blur for Liam.

- It doesn’t help that he’s incredibly charming and laughs so easily despite obviously suffering inside.

- And Liam loves Alex, would probably give his life for him. He would never ever go there, but his heart just aches so much for Alex that sometimes he wants to soothe it by hugging Harry within an inch of his life.

- It doesn’t help that Harry is a tactile person and never refuses a cuddle.

- Not that Liam’s ever partook in one. It’s only ever Louis and Zayn, mostly Zayn.

- Zayn, who gravitates towards Harry in the same way he used to with Alex when they’d just become partners.

- But it’s different, Liam can tell.

- By the three month mark, Harry takes to roaming the hospital corridors aimlessly for hours after his shift.

- Zayn, who’s his permanent shadow nowadays, does not comment.

- Just walks beside him and grabs him by the elbow when he tires himself out enough to start running into walls.

- It’s hard for Zayn to see Harry fall apart piece by piece right in front of his eyes.

- (“I can’t– it’s not right Al, he deserves to know.”)

- (“You know we can’t do that.” Al’s eyes harden, “I don’t want to see Haz suffering any more than you do.”)

- (Zayn swallows, “He’ll hate me.”)

- (Al’s eyes soften, “Harry can’t hate anyone, it’s not in his DNA.”)

- (“You have the same DNA and you hate almost everyone you meet.” Zayn points out.)

- (“Yeah well, I got his half too which is why I’m more full of spite than the normal person.”)

- (Zayn smiles, “They all miss you.”)

- (“I know.”)

- “Alex made enemies in high places.” Zayn tells them two months later, “By the end of our mission we knew we were fucked. There was no way Alex could come back without being hunted by at least five separate organisations.”

- “What are you saying Zayn?” Harry asks after a quiet moment.

- Zayn can’t look him in the eyes but he has to, he has to, because Harry deserves it.

- “Alex is alive.”

- A pin drop silence before Liam makes a sound somewhere between a sob and a growl, “And I suppose you knew all along?”

- Zayn has to steel himself. He doesn’t have the courage to look at Harry anymore. He looks at his shoes instead.

- “Yes, I knew.” And before anyone can open their mouth, he continues, “But only because I was there and Alex needed my help. He didn’t want to put any of you at risk.”

- “Why are you telling us now then? Is he safe now?” Louis asks since neither Harry not Liam seem to be able to speak.

- Zayn nods, “He wasn’t in good terms with the government here, so we made a deal with the US government. Immunity in exchange for information. It was a risky line to walk, our bosses were likely to go after him. It’s why it took so long.”

- “And he didn’t think he could trust us?” Liam shakes with the restraint on his obvious anger, “Trust me?”

- “Liam–“

- “No. Don’t.” He stands up and walks out, shutting the door with such force that Zayn’s key bowl falls and shatters.

- Harry moves back to his apartment a few days later, not having said a single word to Zayn after the broken little “why” he had uttered to break the silence after Liam had stormed out.

- Zayn doesn’t have an answer for him.

- Harry meets Alex the day before he leaves the country.

- “Liam broke up with me.” Is the first thing Alex tells him. The second is, “I’m sorry, I’m so sorry.”

- “I understand, and I’m sorry too.” Harry says.

- He doesn’t tell Alex how Liam visited him once a week at the least and how he had cried for hours the evening before he was supposed to break up with Alex.

- He doesn’t tell him Liam’s reasoning for it. How it’s not just because Alex had him thinking he was missing and possibly dead for five months.

- “I’ll be okay.” Alex gives him a pathetic attempt of a smile.

- “Yes you will.” Harry steps forward and hugs him, “You’re Alex.”

- Alex hugs him back tightly enough to numb him, “Will you visit me?”

- “I will try.” Harry answers honestly.

- Alex pulls away and nods. “Okay. I’m sorry for everything. You deserve a better brother.”

- “I don’t know, I don’t mind you too much.”

- Alex smiles and Harry smiles back.

- “Take care Allie.”

- “You too Hazza.”

- “You lied to me for five months.”

- Zayn sighs, “I know, and I’m sorry.”

- “You also didn’t tell me that you tried to convince Alex to tell me he was alive.”

- “I didn’t think it would matter.”

- A warm hand covers his and Zayn looks up to meet Harry’s eyes.

- “Yeah well, it matters to me.”

———————————————————————

A/N : This fic has been rotting in my drafts for like 2 years and I knew I was never gonna have the motivation to actually write it. So I thought I might as well post this.

If anyone wants to actually write this, you can dm me and we’ll work something out!

body:
Zarry Spy Fic (Part 1)

By popular demand of like 5 people, here it goes! I had to divide it in two parts because it was quite lengthy.

Ps. Keep in mind this was supposed to be a draft for the actual story so there might be some gaps (not major ones).

(Harry has a twin named Alex. Yes I wrote this after watching Dunkirk.)

———————————————————————

- Alex pulls the fire alarm every single time he visits Harry, and Harry gets that he’s a spy and that it’s better if Alex bleeds on the hallway carpet when no one’s there to witness it. But one day it’s gonna be a real fire and Harry’s going to haunt his twin because he didn’t evacuate. He’s pretty sure his neighbours think he’s suicidal. Also the landlord’s getting frustrated trying to figure out why the alarm goes off at odd hours of the night.

- And Harry’s pissed he’s told this code to his spy friends because now he’s there’s a spy bleeding on his mahogany table.

- Harry’s pretty sure he put a nail in his own goddamned foot when he graduated med school. Spies need a lot of fixing up apparently.

- He’s not even surprised when Liam and Louis climb through his fire escape the next night. What’s with spies and fire related things?

- At least it wasn’t the alarm. Or maybe that’s just code red when spies are bleeding out. If Alex based this whole code on a damn pun, Harry’s going to knock him out.

- When Zayn, the half dead spy taking up his bed, tells them his twin went missing on a mission, Harry’s heart stops.

- Also there’s all this talk about moving Harry to a safe location so the people hunting down Alex don’t get him instead.

- Harry tries to be frustrated and go all ‘dammit Alex you idiot’ because that’s easier than losing the little sleep he gets.

- Apparently compromising Zayn’s apartment for their safe base is their best bet.

- Also, it’s just fucking great that Harry and Liam can’t face each other because Liam makes this awful lost-puppy expression when he sees Harry. Harry gets it, he looks like Liam’s missing fiancé but Liam’s about the only one he knows and trusts. Alex would tut at his wording ‘you should never trust spies’.

- Which Harry knows is Alex pulling his leg because Harry eats up all the spy stereotypes.

- Harry has never met Zayn before but he knows Alex trusted him with his life. Which he thinks has to be a good enough reason to trust him.

- It doesn’t change the fact that Zayn’s just as insufferable as Alex when he’s injured.

- Also there’s only so many times Jesse will cover for him before he gets his ass fired.

- So after a lot of stink eye from the spy trio, he’s back at work.

- And everything’s ok until it isn’t.

- And if the spies weren’t being their spy selves and practically stalking Harry without his knowledge, he’d be locked in some basement right now.

- Liam hugs him so tight, Louis has to pry him away from Harry. Harry sometimes forgets the kind of emotional strain he puts on Liam by just existing.

- He doesn’t know if they’d been holding back before somehow, because now all three of them give Harry looks that he doesn’t know what to make of.

- It’s probably his face, which must look even more like Alex’s with a giant bruise on it. He doesn’t think he will recognise Alex without one now.

- It also speeds up the safe house process. Zayn’s flat is weirdly nice.

- He’s also less of an asshole when he’s in his comfort zone. He’s probably swept every nook and cranny of it and has multiple weapons in every part of the place. Harry knows Alex does

- Cereal is also the only edible thing in his whole flat which is unacceptable. Harry’s a doctor, he refuses to eat sugar for all his meals.

- Louis and Liam aren’t permanent residents because it draws more attention to Harry to have them here.

- And Zayn’s healthy enough to take care of him. Which harry doesn’t agree with, because he’s a doctor and knows that his wounds haven’t healed completely.

- The hospital’s actually closer so Harry doesn’t have to travel too much. And one of the trio is always shadowing him.

- There’s this way that Zayn looks at him though. It’s even more indecipherable than the other two’s looks.

- He doesn’t think he wants to know what it’s about.

- It’s almost 7 weeks since Alex has gone missing and 6 weeks since Harry moved in with Zayn

- He’s has a hard day and is delusional with exhaustion when he kisses Zayn.

- Zayn pushes him away which Harry thought would happen, but it doesn’t make it hurt any less.

- Later, he’d ask Zayn, “It’s because it’s him isn’t it? It’s never been me. Do you…love him?”

- Perhaps not the best sequence of words to say when they’re all already so torn over Alex.

- But the way Zayn clenches his jaw and walks away is the only answer Harry needs.

- It’s fine. It’s really fine. Alex always gets the best of ‘em. He always has.

- Except maybe Harry’s a little too attached.

- Crying on Liam isn’t the best idea.

- But Harry has never been known for his good ideas.

- Alex already has Liam, why does he get to have Zayn too?

- Harry hates himself for the thought because Alex is missing and is possibly hurt or lost or…

- Harry doesn’t like to think about the third possibility.

- Liam and Harry are weirdly okay after the whole cry fest.

- “Can I, I’m sorry it’s been a long day. Can I just hug you?” Liam asks.

- And Harry agrees. Because god, he’d give anything to hug alex right now.

- But then Liam is cupping his cheeks and looking at him with a complicated expression.

- Harry puts a hand on his wrist. “I’m not him Li”

- “I know, fuck, do i know.” Liam squeezes his eyes shut like he’s in pain. “You’re nothing like him. Not even remotely.”

- “Just because we have the same face doesn’t mean we’re not individual people you know” but he says it gently. He doesn’t think liam means any harm.

- “I didn’t mean that.” Liam ducks his head sheepishly, “Okay maybe a little. I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to offend. I know that you’re completely different people, but it’s just hard when..”

- “When we look so alike?” Harry grins, not offended in the least. He gets it, kind of.

- “Yeah. You’re just…you. Alex is more… he’s seen so much violence, we all have. It’s all we know. We’re hardwired to think the worst of everyone. You just– you see the world so much differently than us. It’s refreshing. I’ve never seen Alex smile so much– not the way you do.”

- Harry puts a hand on Liam’s chest, stopping him in his tracks once again. “Liam you don’t really want this. You’re tired, it’s been a long day.”

- Liam snaps back to reality. “I’m sorry you’re right. I’m so sorry. I don’t know what I’m doing. I’m kind of going crazy. Alex has been missing for almost two months now and I– I can’t lose him Haz, I can’t.”

- Harry smiles sadly. “Me neither Li.”

- “I think we’ve been neglecting your feelings.” Liam tells him the next morning. “I think all of us were so caught up in what Alex means to us that we forgot that you’re literally his family. His twin. You ought to be hurting more than any of us.”

- “You’re just as much his family as I am.” Harry replies. “I think we’re all hurting. Differently, but hurting all the same. I won’t hold it against you. Besides, you do take care of me, protecting me from the bad guys and all that.”

- “You’re too good for this world Harry Styles.”

Part 2

- He’s not even surprised when Liam and Louis climb through his fire escape the next night. What’s with spies and fire related things?

- At least it wasn’t the alarm. Or maybe that’s just code red when spies are bleeding out. If Alex based this whole code on a damn pun, Harry’s going to knock him out.

- When Zayn, the half dead spy taking up his bed, tells them his twin went missing on a mission, Harry’s heart stops.

- Also there’s all this talk about moving Harry to a safe location so the people hunting down Alex don’t get him instead.

- Harry tries to be frustrated and go all ‘dammit Alex you idiot’ because that’s easier than losing the little sleep he gets.

- Apparently compromising Zayn’s apartment for their safe base is their best bet.

- Also, it’s just fucking great that Harry and Liam can’t face each other because Liam makes this awful lost-puppy expression when he sees Harry. Harry gets it, he looks like Liam’s missing fiancé but Liam’s about the only one he knows and trusts. Alex would tut at his wording ‘you should never trust spies’.

- Which Harry knows is Alex pulling his leg because Harry eats up all the spy stereotypes.

- Harry has never met Zayn before but he knows Alex trusted him with his life. Which he thinks has to be a good enough reason to trust him.

- It doesn’t change the fact that Zayn’s just as insufferable as Alex when he’s injured.

- Also there’s only so many times Jesse will cover for him before he gets his ass fired.

- So after a lot of stink eye from the spy trio, he’s back at work.

- And everything’s ok until it isn’t.

- And if the spies weren’t being their spy selves and practically stalking Harry without his knowledge, he’d be locked in some basement right now.

- Liam hugs him so tight, Louis has to pry him away from Harry. Harry sometimes forgets the kind of emotional strain he puts on Liam by just existing.

- He doesn’t know if they’d been holding back before somehow, because now all three of them give Harry looks that he doesn’t know what to make of.

- It’s probably his face, which must look even more like Alex’s with a giant bruise on it. He doesn’t think he will recognise Alex without one now.

- It also speeds up the safe house process. Zayn’s flat is weirdly nice.

- He’s also less of an asshole when he’s in his comfort zone. He’s probably swept every nook and cranny of it and has multiple weapons in every part of the place. Harry knows Alex does

- Cereal is also the only edible thing in his whole flat which is unacceptable. Harry’s a doctor, he refuses to eat sugar for all his meals.

- Louis and Liam aren’t permanent residents because it draws more attention to Harry to have them here.

- And Zayn’s healthy enough to take care of him. Which harry doesn’t agree with, because he’s a doctor and knows that his wounds haven’t healed completely.

- The hospital’s actually closer so Harry doesn’t have to travel too much. And one of the trio is always shadowing him.

- There’s this way that Zayn looks at him though. It’s even more indecipherable than the other two’s looks.

- He doesn’t think he wants to know what it’s about.

- It’s almost 7 weeks since Alex has gone missing and 6 weeks since Harry moved in with Zayn

- He’s has a hard day and is delusional with exhaustion when he kisses Zayn.

- Zayn pushes him away which Harry thought would happen, but it doesn’t make it hurt any less.

- Later, he’d ask Zayn, “It’s because it’s him isn’t it? It’s never been me. Do you…love him?”

- Perhaps not the best sequence of words to say when they’re all already so torn over Alex.

- But the way Zayn clenches his jaw and walks away is the only answer Harry needs.

- It’s fine. It’s really fine. Alex always gets the best of ‘em. He always has.

- Except maybe Harry’s a little too attached.

- Crying on Liam isn’t the best idea.

- But Harry has never been known for his good ideas.

- Alex already has Liam, why does he get to have Zayn too?

- Harry hates himself for the thought because Alex is missing and is possibly hurt or lost or…

- Harry doesn’t like to think about the third possibility.

- Liam and Harry are weirdly okay after the whole cry fest.

- “Can I, I’m sorry it’s been a long day. Can I just hug you?” Liam asks.

- And Harry agrees. Because god, he’d give anything to hug alex right now.

- But then Liam is cupping his cheeks and looking at him with a complicated expression.

- Harry puts a hand on his wrist. “I’m not him Li”

- “I know, fuck, do i know.” Liam squeezes his eyes shut like he’s in pain. “You’re nothing like him. Not even remotely.”

- “Just because we have the same face doesn’t mean we’re not individual people you know” but he says it gently. He doesn’t think liam means any harm.

- “I didn’t mean that.” Liam ducks his head sheepishly, “Okay maybe a little. I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to offend. I know that you’re completely different people, but it’s just hard when..”

- “When we look so alike?” Harry grins, not offended in the least. He gets it, kind of.

- “Yeah. You’re just…you. Alex is more… he’s seen so much violence, we all have. It’s all we know. We’re hardwired to think the worst of everyone. You just– you see the world so much differently than us. It’s refreshing. I’ve never seen Alex smile so much– not the way you do.”

- Harry puts a hand on Liam’s chest, stopping him in his tracks once again. “Liam you don’t really want this. You’re tired, it’s been a long day.”

- Liam snaps back to reality. “I’m sorry you’re right. I’m so sorry. I don’t know what I’m doing. I’m kind of going crazy. Alex has been missing for almost two months now and I– I can’t lose him Haz, I can’t.”

- Harry smiles sadly. “Me neither Li.”

- “I think we’ve been neglecting your feelings.” Liam tells him the next morning. “I think all of us were so caught up in what Alex means to us that we forgot that you’re literally his family. His twin. You ought to be hurting more than any of us.”

- “You’re just as much his family as I am.” Harry replies. “I think we’re all hurting. Differently, but hurting all the same. I won’t hold it against you. Besides, you do take care of me, protecting me from the bad guys and all that.”

- “You’re too good for this world Harry Styles.”

Part 2
